response_deadline: 5 working days acknowledgment, reasonable time for response
notes: Each agency handles own requests. Appeals within 30 days to Superior Court. No fixed response deadline - 'reasonable time' standard.

basic_request.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request
basic_request.body:
Dear FOAA Officer:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, Title 1, Chapter 13, Maine Revised Statutes, I respectfully request access to inspect and copy the following public records:

[SPECIFIC DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS]

Please acknowledge receipt of this request within 5 working days as required by 1 M.R.S. ยง 408-A, and provide a good faith estimate of the timeframe for response and any associated costs.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide written notice stating the specific reason for denial within 5 working days.

I prefer to receive responsive records in electronic format when possible to minimize costs. Please contact me if you need clarification regarding this request.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
[YOUR ADDRESS]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]

appeal_template.subject: Appeal of FOAA Request Denial
appeal_template.body:
Dear Records Officer:

I am writing to formally appeal the denial of my Freedom of Access Act request dated [DATE]. Your response dated [DATE] denied access to [DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS] citing [REASON FOR DENIAL].

I believe this denial is improper under Maine law because [LEGAL REASONING]. The requested records are clearly public records under Title 1, Chapter 13, Maine Revised Statutes.

Please reconsider this decision and provide the requested records. If you maintain your denial, please be advised that I reserve the right to seek judicial review in Superior Court as provided under 1 M.R.S. ยง 409.

I look forward to your prompt reconsideration of this matter.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
